main.cpp

00011  to me at gerstrong@gmail.com or get my latest email
00012  from the SourceForge site.
00013  
00014  Thanks to ID Software for the "Commander Keen: Invasion of
00015  the Vorticons" games. "Commander Keen" and it's associated
00016  graphics, level, and sound files are the property of ID
00017  Software. Commander Genius requires the original version of a
00018  Commander Keen game in order to be able to interpret that
00019  episode.
00020  
00021  Enjoy the Code
00022  - The Commander Genius Team

00029 #include "CLogFile.h"
00030 #include "CGame.h"
00031 #include "FindFile.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * \brief  This is the function where CG beings
00035  *
00036  * \param argc    number of arguments
00037  * \param argv    pointer to  char arrays where
00038  *      where the passed arguments are stored
00039  *      in the process
00040  * \return         This always returns 0. If
00041  *      some errors appear, please take a look
00042  *      at the Logfile.
00043  *
00044  */
00045 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00046 {
00047  if(argc >= 1) {
00048   binary_dir = argv[0];
00049   size_t slashpos = findLastPathSep(binary_dir);
00050   if(slashpos != std::string::npos)  {
00051    binary_dir.erase(slashpos);
00052    binary_dir = SystemNativeToUtf8(binary_dir);
00053   } else
00054    binary_dir = ".";
00055  } else {
00056   warnings << "Binary-argument not given, assuming current dir" << endl;
00057   binary_dir = ".";
00058  }
00059  binary_dir = GetAbsolutePath(binary_dir);
00060 
00061  InitSearchPaths();
00062 
00063  g_pLogFile->CreateLogfile("CGLog.html");
00064   
00065  CGame Game;
00066  ////////////////////////////
00067  // Initialize Game Engine //
00068  ////////////////////////////
00069  if( Game.init( argc, argv ) )
00070  {
00071   ///////////////////////
00072   // Start Game Engine //
00073   ///////////////////////
00074   Game.run();
00075  }
00076  
00077  /////////////////////////
00078  // Cleanup Game Engine //
00079  /////////////////////////
00080  Game.cleanup();
00081  
00082  g_pLogFile->Del();
00083 
00084  printf("Thank you very much for playing this wonderful game!");
00085  
00086  return 0;
00087 }
